task.title: Creating a keystore
task.shortdesc: Keys must be contained within a keystore. Keystores are easy to create from within the Signing and Keys view.

step.cmd: If necessary, open the Signing and Keys view by selecting Window Show View Other and then selecting MOTODEV Studio Signing and Keys from the list of views. Note that this view is part of the MOTODEV Studio for Android perspective and is thus normally opened when you switch to that perspective.
In the Signing and Keys toolbar, click (Create Keystore).
step.stepresult: The Create Keystore dialog is displayed.

step.cmd: Specify the name (including the path to the file) to be given to the keystore file using the Keystore Filename field.

Choose a keystore type from the Keystore Type pull-down list. The available choices are: JKS (the standard Java keystore), JCEKS (a Java keystore that provides much stronger protection of private keys), or PKCS12 (a file format defined as part of the Public-Key Cryptography Standards [PKCS] that can be created and interpreted using the OpenSSL pkcs12 command).
By default, the chosen keystore type is added to the keystore filename you specified as an extension. Clear this option if you don't want this extension to be automatically added.

Provide a password to be used to protect the keystore using the Keystore Password and Confirm Password fields. You will be prompted to reenter this password whenever you add keys to or alter keys within the keystore.
If you would like MOTODEV Studio to remember this keystore's password and automatically supply it whenever it is needed, select Save this password.

choices.choice: Click Finish to create a new, empty keystore.
